doc.previous: In general energy conversion efficiency is the ratio between the useful output of a device and the input in energy terms For thermal efficiency the input to the device is heat or the heat content of a fuel that is consumed The desired output is mechanical work or heat or possibly both Because the input heat normally has a real financial cost a memorable generic definition of thermal efficiency is 1
doc.after: From the first law of thermodynamics the energy output cannot exceed the input so
